title: What is the greatest known defeat of a chess icon or master via use of a 'Grob' variation? - Quora

response.answer_text: What is the greatest known defeat of a chess icon or master via use of a "Grob" variation? I presume you mean the opening known as Grob’s Attack, 1.g4? It is very seldom played in high level chess. Searching through ChessBase 17, I found two instances where a grandmaster faced it and lost: Skembris,Spyridon (2415) - Ivkov,Borislav (2510) [A00] Budva zt Budva (15), 1981: 1.g4 d5 2.Bg2 c6 3.h3 e5 4.d3 Ne7 5.Nf3 Ng6 6.Nc3 Nh4 7.Nxh4 Qxh4 8.e4 Bc5 9.Qe2 d4 10.Nb1 Nd7 11.Nd2 Bb4 12.a3 Bxd2+ 13.Bxd2 Nf8 14.0–0–0 Ne6 15.Kb1 Bd7 16.Rhf1 h5 17.Bf3 hxg4 18.Bxg4 g5 19.Rg1 Nf4 20.Bxf4 gxf4 21.Qd2 Bxg4 22.Rxg4 Qe7 23.Qa5 b6 24.Qa6 Qc7 25.Rdg1 Ke7 26.Qc4 Raf8 27.Rg7 Rh6 28.R1g5 Qd6 29.Rf5 Rf6 30.Rh5 b5 31.Qb3 Rh6 32.Rf5 Rf6 33.Rh5 Rh6 34.Rxh6 Qxh6 35.Qb4+ Qd6 36.Qa5 Kf6 37.Rg4 Qd7 38.f3 Rh8 39.h4 Rh7 40.Qe1 Qe6 41.Qg1 Ke7 42.Rg8 Rh6 43.Ra8 Rg6 44.Qe1 Kf6 45.b3 Qd6 46.Qa5 Qc5 47.Qd8+ Ke6 48.Qe8+ Kf6 49.Qh8+ Ke6 50.Rg8 Qxa3 51.Rxg6+ fxg6 52.Qg7 Qe7 53.Qxg6+ Qf6 54.Qe8+ Kd6 55.Qb8+ Ke6 56.Qg8+ Kd6 57.h5 Qh4 58.Qb8+ Kd7 59.Qxa7+ Ke6 60.Qc5 Qxh5 61.Qxc6+ Kf7 62.Qd7+ Kg8 63.Qe6+ Kh7 64.Kb2 Qxf3 65.Qxe5 Qe3 66.Qf5+ Kh6 67.e5 Qd2 68.Qf6+ Kh5 69.Qc6 Kg5 70.Qf6+ Kh5 71.Qh8+ Kg5 72.Qd8+ Kg6 73.Qxd4 b4 74.Qe4+ Kg5 75.e6 Qc3+ 76.Kb1 f3 77.e7 f2 78.Qe3+ Kf6 79.e8N+ 1–0 Vlassov,Nikolai (2476) - Nakamura,Hikaru (2571) [A00] Mallorca Trophy final Schach Online Spielen INT (2.3), 08.02.2004: 1.g4 c5 2.Bg2 Nc6 3.e4 d6 4.Nc3 e5 5.d3 Be6 6.h3 Nge7 7.Nge2 Ng6 8.Nd5 Nh4 9.Kf1 g5 10.c3 h6 11.Ng3 Bg7 12.Nh5 0–0 13.Be3 Ne7 14.Ndf6+ Kh8 15.Nxg7 Kxg7 16.Nh5+ Kh7 17.d4 cxd4 18.cxd4 Neg6 19.Kg1 Nf4 20.Bxf4 gxf4 21.f3 f6 22.Qe1 Ng6 23.Qb4 Qb6 24.Qxb6 axb6 25.d5 Bd7 26.Rc1 Rac8 27.Rxc8 Bxc8 28.Kf2 Ne7 29.Rc1 Kg6 30.Rc7 Kf7 31.Ke1 Ke8 32.Kd2 Kd8 33.Rc3 Bd7 34.Bf1 Rf7 35.Ra3 Bc8 36.Bb5 Kc7 37.Ra8 Kd8 38.Kd3 Kc7 39.a4 Rf8 40.Ng7 Ng6 41.Ne8+ Rxe8 42.Bxe8 Nh4 43.Ke2 Ng2 44.b3 Ne3 45.Kd2 Nf1+ 46.Kd3 Ne3 47.Bf7 b5 48.Be6 Bd7 49.Bxd7 1–0

One I can come up with is John Nunn being defeated by Michael John Basman in 1978. Here you can find the game: Michael John Basman vs John Nunn (1978) Basman and Grobbin' John Nunn was once a world's top ten player. Michael John Basman was a regular player of the Grob opening.
